Teepee (teepee) + 豆 (bean)

ONYOMI: TOU

If you climb to the top of my teepee on tipTOE, you will find a magic bean .

KUNYOMI:

( に ) の＊ぼる
    climbー only used with mountains, cliffs and ladders.
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

に 登場 する (に とうじょう する)
    to enter the stage －　literally (making ones first appearance in a given movie or tv show) or figuratively ( by making a debut in show biz)
    登 (climb) + 場 (place) = 登場 (enter the stage)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
山登り ( やまのぼり )
    mountain-climbing. （verb form:　やまのぼる）
    山 (mountain) + 登 (climb) = 山登り (mountain climbing)
    Star-16Star-16

Number: 1184
際 edge
Star-16Star-16Star-16
14 strokes
Town (town) + 祭 (festival) (Same-ON)

ONYOMI: SAI

The festival of SIGHs is on the edge of town, over there.

KUNYOMI:

( xxx ) きわ
    SUFFIX attatched to a place or thing , meaning close to or on the border or edge of something- usually used with locations: Im standing on the edge of the ocean, where it meets the shore. It is pronounced GIWA. (SUF)
    Star-16

JUKUGO:

実際 に ( じっさい に)
    in fact. (as in, You think youre Samoan, but in fact, youre adopted.)

    Also has the nuance of in practice, as opposed to in theory.
    実 (truth) + 際 (edge) = 実際 (in fact)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
ｘｘｘの 際 にYYY (ｘｘｘの さい にYYY)
    "at the time of XXX, do YYY" .. . As in, As long as youre going to the kitchen, get me some pretzels, you crazy broad.
    Star-16Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
審 	judge 	NUMBER 	番
察 	police 	FESTIVAL 	祭
際 	edge 	TOWN 	Town
擦 	chafe 	HAND 	手

When the judge gives you a NUMBER of years in prison,

the police will have a FESTIVAL on the edge of TOWN.

Your HAND is chafing against my thigh.


Number: 1185
察 police
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
14 strokes
ILL PAIR
Crown (crown) + 祭 (festival)

ONYOMI: SATSU

I SAW TWO police at the festival, wearing crowns.

KUNYOMI:

さっ*する
    CULTURAL CODE WORD. To infer the feelings of other people (usually in the sense of being a good host or sentitive friend) (as opposed to 気が利く , which refers to actually physically doing something for that person, based on what you さっするed!). (CCW)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

警察 ( けいさつ )
    police (NP)
    警 (the fuzz) + 察 (police) = 警察 (police)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
推察 ( すいさつ )
    to guess or speculate about the meaning of someones behavior or words. 推察 is only used when you have no real proof.
    推 (infer) + 察 (police) = 推察 (guess or speculate )
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

Number: 1187
Open open
PK
(open radical)

DESCRIPTION: This should be easy to remember if you look at the kanji for closed and open:
閉 開
You can almost see the left-side line of オ sliding over and, er, opening up, to transform into the kanji for open.
USED IN:

    開
    発
    形
    研
    刑

DUH

( を ) あ＊ける
    I open something (door, envelope)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
( が ) あ＊く
    to get opened - the automatic doors swung open
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
( を ) ひら＊く
    hold a party or call a meeting. Open the way for something to happen.
    Star-16

JUKUGO:

開放 する ( かいほう する)
    emancipate, let loose
    開 (open) + 放 (release) = 開放 (emancipate, let loose )
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
公開 する ( こうかい する)
    open to the public
    公 (public) + 開 (open) = 公開 (open to the public)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
開発 ( かいはつ )
    development
    開 (open) + 発 (launch) = 開発 (development)

形 form

DESCRIPTION: the OTHER kata (型) is the figurative one , meaning proper way to do. This kata just means a literal form or shape.

KUNYOMI:

かた
    form. Literally the shape of something (unlike the other かた　（型）、you can use 形 regardless of if that thing is unique or very conventional).

かたち
    body
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

    doll (FP)
    人 (person) + 形 (form) = 人形 (doll)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
命令形 ( めいれいけい )
    the command form of Japanese grammar.
    命­令 (an order, a command. ) + 形 (form) = 命令形 (the command form of Japanese grammar.)
    Star-16Star-16
三角形 ( さんかくけい )
    triangle
    三­角 (triangle) + 形 (form) = 三角形 (triangle)
    Star-16Star-16

    plastic surgery
    整 (arrange) + 形 (form) = 整形 (plastic surgery)

Number: 1194
型 type or proper way
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
9 strokes
CCW, DUPE
刑 (penalty) (Same-ON) + 土 (earth)

ONYOMI: KEI

If its done the proper way, its OK

The earth pays the penalty for our type of pollution.

DESCRIPTION: This is one of those critical cultural code words. Kata refers to the proper way of doing things, which is why Japanese kids imitate their idols exactly, why you have old guys obsessed with collecting EVERY skate or thrash 7" from 1984 regardless of if its any good.

KUNYOMI:

かた
    2 meanings: model and type.

    Model, as in clay or plaster mold, or cookie-cutter stamp, or (figuratively) as in a social convention or conformity. (this book is too cliche, it just follows all the rules of the style!).

    Type as in blood type, or "new type" (i.e. this years model of crime-fighting robot). (CCW)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

血液型 ( けつえきがた )
    blood type (KUNKUN)
    血 (blood) + 液 (liquid) + 型 (type or proper way) = 血液型 (blood type)
    Star-16Star-16
典型的 な ( てんけいてき な)
    typical　thing of that type.
    典 (classic) + 型 (type or proper way) + 的 (motivation or -al) = 典型的 (typical)
    Star-16Star-16
模型 ( もけい )
    a model (this is literal! Model, like a snap-tite model car or model train)
    模 (model) + 型 (type or proper way) = 模型 (plastic model)
    Star-16



Number: 1195
午 noon
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
4 strokes
BETA
干 (dry out) + 一 (one or line radical)

ONYOMI: GO

Get Out of my house by noon!

Lets call the single line (upper left corner) a left sock. Thus:
Every NOON, I hang my left sock out to dry.
JUKUGO:

午後 ( ごご )
    pm
    午 (noon) + 後 (afterwards or behind) = 午後 (pm)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
午前 ( ごぜん )
    AM , before noon.
    午 (noon) + 前 (before) = 午前 (AM)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
牛 	cow 	HEAD 	
午 	noon 	NO HEAD 	

The cow has a head that sticks up in the middle.

Noon does not have a head because it is an abstract concept, not a physical animal with four nipples.

I had to google that. This is my job.

    牛
    許

Number: 1197
牛 cow
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
4 strokes
午 (noon)

ONYOMI: GYUU

GYUU is the Japanese sound-effect for hugging. Picture the farmer hugging the cows nipples to make the milk come out.

Cow is basically noon (午) plus a little head sticking up on top: Heres how to remember the difference:

The cow has a head that sticks up in the middle. Noon does not have a head because it is an abstract concept, not a physical animal with 8 nipples.

KUNYOMI:

うし
    cow
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

牛乳 ( ぎゅうにゅう )
    cows milk
    牛 (cow) + 乳 (milk) = 牛乳 (cows milk)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
牛肉 ( ぎゅうにく )
    beef
    牛 (cow) + 肉 (meat) = 牛肉 (beef)
    Star-16Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
牛 	cow 	HEAD 	
午 	noon 	NO HEAD 	

The cow has a head that sticks up in the middle.

Noon does not have a head because it is an abstract concept, not a physical animal with four nipples.

I had to google that. This is my job.

If it pleases the gods, it is righteous to sacrifice a cow!

What a waste!

If I was you, Id just study the word 犠牲 and forget about studying the individual kanji.

Sort of reminds you of 喧嘩, doesnt it? Two kanji with the same left- radical that are only used in conjunction with one another.

Number: 1203
Thing thing
PK
(right radical)

DESCRIPTION: This radical is mainly used in the animal kanji (物)

So, if you need a mnemonic - picture it as a ribcage. . .which is a thing.
USED IN:

    物
    惚
    易
    豚



Number: 1204
物 animal or thing
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
8 strokes
牛 (cow) + Thing (thing)

ONYOMI: BUTSU or MOTSU

I refuse to knock BOOTS with MOST animals. Even your mom.

A cow has a ribcage, therefore it is an animal.

DESCRIPTION: This is one of the most useful kanji. But its also one of the most disgraceful kanji when it comes to using KUNyomi in random jukugo. Like 50% of the time itll use MONO instead of the onyomi. And even when it DOES use the onyomi, theres two onyomi which are ALSO used randomly.

Fuck!

On the good side, however, most of the 物 jukugo are so common that youll pick them up in no time.

KUNYOMI:

もの
    thing
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

動物 ( どうぶつ )
    animal
    動 (movement) + 物 (animal or thing) = 動物 (animal)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
買い物 する ( かいもの する)
    shopping
    買 (buy) + 物 (animal or thing) = 買い物 (shopping)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
植物 ( しょくぶつ )
    plant
    植 (plant) + 物 (animal or thing) = 植物 (plant)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
荷物 ( にもつ )
    luggage or belongings. Also, cargo (if youre a ships captain). Also, emotional baggage, or a metaphorical burden (FP)
    荷 (luggage) + 物 (animal or thing) = 荷物 (luggage)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
着物 ( きもの )
    kimono. (KUNKUN)
    着 (wear or arrive) + 物 (animal or thing) = 着物 (kimono. )
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
登場人物 ( とうじょうじんぶつ )
    a character in a book, play, novel, movie, etc.
    登­場 (to enter the stage －　literally (making ones first appearance in a given movie or tv show) or figuratively ( by making a debut in show biz)) + 人 (person) + 物 (animal or thing) = 登場人物 (character)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
本物 ( ほんもの )
    the real thing, not a counterfeit. (KUNKUN)
    本 (book or the real) + 物 (animal or thing) = 本物 (the real thing, not a counterfeit.)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
博物館 ( はくぶつかん )
    museum
    博 (museum　 or extensive) + 物 (animal or thing) + 館 (big hall) = 博物館 (museum)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
禁物 ( きんもつ )
    taboo or forbidden thing
    禁 (prohibition) + 物 (animal or thing) = 禁物 (taboo or forbidden thing )
    Star-16



Number: 1205
惚 to fall in love with
Star-16
11 strokes
心 (leftheart) + Thing (thing) + 心 (bottomheart)

ONYOMI:

Two hearts fall in love with the same thing: a typical love triangle.

KUNYOMI:

( に ) ほ*れる
    to fall in love with　－ unlike 愛 (ai) or 恋愛 (renai), 惚れる is more often used to describe a one-sided affection - first you 惚れる and if youre lucky the other person likes you back, and THEN you get your 恋愛。 If you know what I mean. (KANA)
    Star-16

JUKUGO:

一目惚れ ( ひとめぼれ )
    love at first sight (KANA)
    一 (one) + 目 (eye) + 惚 (to fall in love with) = 一目惚れ (love at first sight)
    Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
愉 	pleasure 	BUTCHER 	Butcher
惚 	to fall in love with 	RIBCAGE 	Thing

It gives the BUTCHER pleasure to fall in love with a ANIMAL RIBCAGE.

Number: 1211
場 place
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
12 strokes
PN, SUF, BETA, COCK
土 (earth) + 易 (easy)

ONYOMI: JOU

Its easy for JOE Stalin to take over all places on the earth with his legions of fanatics.

DESCRIPTION:This is a COCK because - in jukugos - it uses the KUN and ON pronunciations pretty much randomly. So not only do you not know how to pronounce the words, you also dont know how to look them up in the damn dictionary.

KUNYOMI:

( xxx ) ば
    SUFFIX! xxx場 means the place where　we do XXX (i.e. graveyard is grave-場, slaughter house is slaughter 場 and so on) Unlike the related kanji 所,　場 emphasizes the activity rather than the location. (SUF)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

xxxの 場合 (xxxの ばあい )
    in the case of XXX (KUNKUN)
    場 (place) + 合 (to suit) = 場合 (in the case of XXX)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
場所 ( ばしょ )
    place, like a parking lot. Also space, as in, your moms cant ride in my new van because theres not enough space.

    This is by far the most popular word to use these kanji, so its too bad the pronunciation is messed up: 場 uses kun, but 所 uses onyomi. Assholes. (KUN ON)
    場 (place) + 所 (area or attribute) = 場所 (place)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
登場人物 ( とうじょうじんぶつ )
    a character in a book, play, novel, movie, etc.
    登­場 (to enter the stage －　literally (making ones first appearance in a given movie or tv show) or figuratively ( by making a debut in show biz)) + 人 (person) + 物 (animal or thing) = 登場人物 (character)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
現場 ( げんば )
    the current place. (this one is used on the YOU ARE HERE part of maps) (KUN ON)
    現 (present time) + 場 (place) = 現場 (the current place)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
立場 ( たちば )
    point of view, usually used like: XXXの立場からして。。。（from XXXs point of view. . . ) (KUNKUN, NOKURI)
    立 (stand up) + 場 (place) = 立場 (point of view)
    Star-16

The only hint I can give you is this: in the NAMES of colors, 色 tends to use the KUN, while in other jukugo it uses the traditional ON. Usually. If it wants to.

    drivers license

    literally, "rule," but closer to the English word for "discipline."Rules typically say "dont do this or that," but 規律 give long lists of things you HAVE TO do, in the order you have to do them. Like if youre at military school, you have to get up at 5:30, have your bed made by 5:35, shine your shoes by 5:40, and report to the mess hall.
    規 (criteria) + 律 (regulation) = 規律 (rules or discipline)

And the decapitated cow sometimes is drawn with a little line in the center（）- this is symbolic of a cow that was decapitated quite recently and theres hence still a little blood fountain coming out the neck. Logical? You bet! I think of everything!

Number: 1249
撤 withdraw
Star-16Star-16
15 strokes
BETA, PN
Hand (handleft) + Order rule (decapitated cow) + 月 (moon or organ) + Taskmaster (director)

ONYOMI: TETSU

This is basically the exact same as the previous kanji (徹) - even the onyomi is the damn same. So rather than try to make another mnemonic to tie together director, decapitated cow, and moon. . . it might be simpler to just think of this kanji as "do thoroughly with a hand instead of a damn 行 on the left".

So you can say,

I withdraw my hand thoroughly from your corrupted embrace!!!
JUKUGO:

を　 or に　 or 　から 撤去 する (を　 or に　 or 　から てっきょ する)
    to remove or dismantle
    撤 (withdraw) + 去 (past tense) = 撤去 (dismantle)
    Star-16

    to withdraw or retract a comment
    撤 (withdraw) + 回 (rotate or times) = 撤回 (to withdraw or retract a comment )
    - zero stars! -

ONYOMI: CHI

DESCRIPTION:This is the kanji for "いたします" as in, "どう いたしまして!" (youre welcome, sir!) or "失礼いたします!" (please excuse me, madam!) ...all those polite expressions. p> However, theyre usually written in hiragana these days.

KUNYOMI:

いた*す
    most dictionaries or websites describe this as to bring about which is kind of ambiguous and makes it more confusing than it is.

    Its better to think of いたす　as THE POLITE FORMAL VERSION OF する. (usually KANA, so Im only givin it one star! *) (KANA)
    Star-16

JUKUGO:

XXX 致します (XXX いたします )
    the polite form of suru, used by clerks when addressing your noble presence.　However, unlike suru, itashimasu can be used with any verb.

    XXXs verb form is masu minus: for instance, mochimasu becomes mochi itashimasu. (F, 1 or 2 KANA)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
一致 する ( いっち する)
    to correspond with, to match ("The crime scene DNA matches your moms semen"; "This example corresponds to the itasu kanji")
    一 (one) + 致 (polite "do") = 一致 (to match)
    Star-16Star-16

    convert to new ideology, do an about-face. This is important because most of the freaky looking kids you see on the street will all become housewives and salarimen the exact second they turn ２3. - making TENKOU what we call a "cultural code word." (CCW)
    転 (roll over) + 向 (turn to face) = 転向 (do an about-face)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
転勤 ( てんきん )
    when a salariman gets transferred to another office, thats tenkin.

    I only mention this because most of the Japanese you meet who speak good English, probably one of their parents got tenkin-ed to America or UK, so it tends to come up in conversation.
    転 (roll over) + 勤 (be employed at) = 転勤 (transfer)
    - zero stars! -

勢 power

KUNYOMI:

いきお*い
    most dictionaries or books or apps define this as POWER but its more like momentum, (a power which is in motion). The power to influence something - like "The car had a lot of 勢い so it was hard to stop the car before we hit the cat." or "Because of the whiskeys 勢い, I could do a table dance in the White House."

    Also means to gain steam or lose steam - said of political momentum or the momentum of a trend or ideology.
    Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

姿勢 ( しせい )
    ｐｏｓｔｕｒｅ　－　 posture, both literal and figurative. Unlike the related word 態度（たいど） ones 姿勢 is always intentional - something one consciously adopts.
    姿 (someones shape, body, form) + 勢 (power) = 姿勢 (ｐｏｓｔｕｒｅ)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
大勢 ( おおぜい )
    a large number of people - not in the sense of Its crowded today but like There were crowds waiting to greet the Ambassador - the crowd is united in its purpose.
    大 (big) + 勢 (power) = 大勢 (crowd)

    contradiction or hypocrisy　 (interesting: the kanji literally mean spear plus shield! Picture a guy claiming his shield is for self-defense, even as he holds a bloody spear in his other hand) . . ..

    Japanese, tellingly, does not have a word for hypocrisy, so if you want to say hypocrite, you have to use this word (mujun) and try and make it fit.
    矛 (halberd) + 盾 (shield) = 矛盾 (contradiction )
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

Number: 1311
懸 suspend or gamble
Star-16Star-16
20 strokes
DUPE
県 (prefecture) (Same-ON) + 系 (group, tribe) + 心 (bottomheart)

ONYOMI: KEN

I would bet my heart that well find the lost tribe in this prefecture!

KUNYOMI:

( を ) か＊ける
    literally, to hang or suspend something. But since usually Japanese use the 掛 kanji to mean hang, 懸 is more often used figuratively: meaning, to gamble or stake something. Ones life, ones heart, ones money, etc.
    Star-16Star-16
( が ) か＊かる
    it is hanging or it depends on xxx. Perhaps more accurately, "XXX is at stake."
    Star-16Star-16

    to really bust ass and do ones utmost.
    一 (one) + 生 (life or birth) + 懸 (suspend or gamble) + 命 (life) = 一生懸命 (bust ass)

Number: 1312
直 correct a probem or direct contact
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
8 strokes
DUPE, PN, JERK
Ten eyes (the fly) + L (loser)

ONYOMI: CHOKU or JIKI

My hand directly smacks the fly because its a loser. (and it vomited on my CHOCOlate) This fixed the problem of vomi-chocolate. Now I feel more JIGGY.

DESCRIPTION: In jukugo, 直 tends to use CHOKU in words that have to do with direct contact, and JIKI in words which have to do with fixing things or being nice.

KUNYOMI:

( を ) なお＊す
    to fix or reform or correct a problem ( a broken chair, an inneficient beuraracrarcy, a poorly spelled word). Doesnt mean the thing was totally fucked up. Sometimes 直す just means do some minor alterations or revisions to make some shit perfect. Also means redo, as in かけ直して (phone me back).
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
( が ) なお＊る
    it gets fixed
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

直接 の　or　に ( ちょくせつ の　or　に)
    directly (not just direct communication, but direct anything) (adjective form:直接的な）
    直 (correct a probem or direct contact) + 接 (directly contact) = 直接 (direct.)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
正直 な ( しょうじき な)
    very honest person, very loyal. Person with integrity. Also means, "To tell you the truth. . . xxxx"
    正 (correct) + 直 (correct a probem or direct contact) = 正直 (honest or loyal)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
ｘｘｘ　と 仲直り する (ｘｘｘ　と なかなおり する)
    to make up　with XXX , to restore a friendship
    仲 (friendship) + 直 (correct a probem or direct contact) = 仲直り (to make up)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
素直 な ( すなお な)
    obedient, gentle (kind of usually used in a sexist way to compliment a lady. I have a hat with sunao written on the front which always is good for nervous laughter.) (KUN ON)
    素 (element) + 直 (correct a probem or direct contact) = 素直 (obedient)
    Star-16Star-16
直前 に ( ちょくぜん に)
    immediately before
    直 (correct a probem or direct contact) + 前 (before) = 直前 (immediately before )
    Star-16

    Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

位置 してる ( いち してる)
    be located at a certain spot (as in, the 7-11 is located north of the mountains but south of the sea)

    Star-16Star-16
処置 ( しょち )
    deal with a problem that just cropped up. Usually used in business situations: deal with the missing money! Take care of the radiation leak. Manage the PR crisis.
    処 (dispose of) + 置 (put down on table) = 処置 (take care of it!)
    Star-16Star-16
放置 する ( ほうち する)
    to leave something alone. (similar to 怠る (neglect), but 放置 is value-neutral. 放置する just means "leave it as it is.")
    放 (release) + 置 (put down on table) = 放置 (leave it as-is!)
    Star-16Star-16

Number: 1317
殖 multiply
Star-16
12 strokes
DUPE, SIDEKICK
Ssshhhh (shhh) + 直 (correct a probem or direct contact)

ONYOMI: SHOKU

It might SHOCK you to know how rabbits multiply.

Shhh!! Im trying to correct a sexual problem and I need to concentrate.
JUKUGO:

生殖 する ( せいしょく する)
    reproduction, as in reproductive organs, or the reproductive process (NP)
    生 (life or birth) + 殖 (multiply) = 生殖 (reproduction)
    Star-16
繁殖 ( はんしょく )
    breeding. Unlike the related term 生殖 （せいしょく）、繁殖 refers to the entire process of finding a mate, not just the physical act of insemination: Breeding grounds. Mating season. Farmers breeding livestock.
    繁 (reproduction) + 殖 (multiply) = 繁殖 (breeding)
    - zero stars! -

( と ) わか*れる
    to separate, like break up with, or like when you separate wheat from the chaff.
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
べつ ( にｘｘｘ )
    means especially , but always used in the negative: そのゴハンは別においしくない。　（’this food is not really delicious.)(used by itself, as a short declaration, its a good reply to anyone who asks you a dumb question) (SARC)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
べつ ( のｘｘｘ )
    a different kind of thing
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

特別 な ( とくべつ な)
    special
    特 (special) + 別 (separate) = 特別 (special )
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
別々 ( べつべつ )
    separately, as in "separate checks"　at a restaraunt
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
区別 する ( くべつ する)
    to make a distinction - to tell one thing from another - 2 synonyms, for instance. or 2 similar-looking kanji
    区 (ward) + 別 (separate) = 区別 (distinguish)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

    gender
    性 (sex or essential nature) + 別 (separate) = 性別 (gender)
    Star-16Star-16

The MOUTH is loud which makes it separate

皮肉 ( ひにく )
    sarcasm OR irony. Japanese DO have a sense of sarcasm,(for example, calling the traditional chicken-and-scrambled-eggs dish "parents and child") but it is so different than the Western say-the-opposite-of-what-you-mean style that Japanese dont have a word for western sarc. So they seem to have taken their word for Irony and pressed it into service for sarcasm as well. (SARC)
    皮 (skin) + 肉 (meat) = 皮肉 (sarcasm or irony)

Number: 1342
頼 ask a favor
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
16 strokes
束 (bundle of sticks) + Face (headright)

ONYOMI: RAI

I wanted to ask you a favor -- can you carry this bundle on your head? Its really LIGHT.

Thanks!

KUNYOMI:

たの*む
    to ask someone to do something for you. You can use this when ordering food at a restaraunt, but also when asking a favor from a friend. たのむ has the nuance that the person being asked can refuse. (1 or 2 KANA)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
たの＊み
    a favor, a request.
    Star-16Star-16
( に or を ) たよ＊る
    to trust or rely on someone: Say, youre robbing a bank and you get your friend to be the getaway driver. You have to count on him to actually be waiting when you get out of the bank.
    Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

依頼 する ( いらい する)
    a request or commission. Not like Please pass the salt, but like Id like to hire you to make a custom suit or to hire a lawyer or PR firm. Any relationship where youd use the phrase "The client wants. . ... "is 依頼。
    依 (depend on) + 頼 (ask a favor) = 依頼 (commission)
    Star-16Star-16
依頼人 ( いらいにん )
    client (NP)
    依­頼 (a request or commission. Not like Please pass the salt, but like Id like to hire you to make a custom suit or to hire a lawyer or PR firm. Any relationship where youd use the phrase "The client wants. . ... "is 依頼。 ) + 人 (person) = 依頼人 (client)
    Star-16
信頼 ( しんらい )
    trust
    信 (believe) + 頼 (ask a favor) = 信頼 (trust)
    - zero stars! -

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
頼 	ask a favor 	HEAD 	頭
額 	amount of money or forehead 	EACH 	各
疎 	shun 	STOP 	止

You ask a favor: that I give HEAD.

EACH of you asks for an amount of money.

So I shun you, I STOP talking to you.

速 fast

KUNYOMI:

はや*い
    fast speed
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
すみ＊やか ( に )
    like 早速, but emphasizes finishing something quickly, rather than STARTING it immediately. Usually used in an office - give this document or procedure top priority! (NP)
    Star-16

JUKUGO:

早速 xxxしろ！ ( さっそく xxxしろ！)
    do XXX immediately! (FP, 1 or 2 KANA)
    早 (early) + 速 (fast) = 早速 (do XXX immediately!)
    Star-16Star-16
速度 ( そくど )
    speed
    速 (fast) + 度 (times) = 速度 (speed)
    Star-16



Number: 1344
整 arrange
Star-16Star-16Star-16
16 strokes
束 (bundle of sticks) + Taskmaster (director) + 止 (stop)

ONYOMI: SEI

The director says, you gotta stop doing what youre doing and arrange these sticks into a bundle.

KUNYOMI:

( を ) ととの＊える
    to arrange or prepare - usually used with "prepare a hairstyle", or "clean up a sentence on a re-write of a paper", and not used anywhere else. Sometimes books will refer to someone who is pretty as having a 整った顔 (totono-ta kao) (literally: a well-arranged face!)
    Star-16Star-16
( が ) ととの＊う
    something is arranged in a certain formation.
    Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

整理 する ( せいり する)
    arrange things, like arranging papers alphabetically, or arranging books by topic.
    整 (arrange) + 理 (reason) = 整理 (arrange)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
整形 ( せいけい )
    plastic surgery
    整 (arrange) + 形 (form) = 整形 (plastic surgery)
    Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
整 	arrange 	BUNDLE 	束
裂 	tear up 	SWORD 	刀

You arrange sticks in a BUNDLE,
but you tear up shit with your SWORD.

DESCRIPTION: I call it the pass radical because its the main radical in pass, one of the most common kanji.

    踊

Number: 1346

( が ) とお＊る
    to go past???
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
( を ) とお＊す
    I make something go in or through - either literally (i.e. threading a needle, escorting a guest inside) or figuratively (to force ones opinion through a meeting or to keep crying all night)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
( で or に ) かよ＊う
    go to (used only with places like school or work, where you go there regularly)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
どお＊り
    a big road, an avenue. (NUBI - 通りis a SUFFIX which goes after the name of the avenue. Youd never say, "Hey, which way is the 通り?") (NUBI)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

普通 の or　に ( ふつう の or　に)
    normal or normally

    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
交通 ( こうつう )
    traffic
    交 (combine) + 通 (pass) = 交通 (traffic)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

Number: 1355
痴 molester
Star-16Star-16
13 strokes
BETA
Sickness (sick) + 知 (know)

ONYOMI: CHI

The molester acquires sick knowledge in his CHEESY exploits.
JUKUGO:

痴漢 ( ちかん )
    Usually 漢 means Chinese: its used in a lot of obscure words (Chinese dictionary, Chinese herbal medicine, Chinese classical literature, etc.)

    HOWEVER - aside from 漢字 - the only time 漢 is really used in daily life is here: 痴漢, meaning a guy who molests or gropes women on crowded trains.

    So the literal reading is: sick Chinese !WTF??? (FR, 1 or 2 KANA)
    痴 (molester) + 漢 (Chinese) = 痴漢 (train pervert)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
ｘｘｘ 音痴 である (ｘｘｘ おんち である)
    literally, to be tone-deaf, unable to carry a tune. But you can also say, 方向音痴, which means to have no sense of direction,to get lost a lot. One more idiom: 運動音痴: (undou onchi) means terrible at sports.
    音 (sound) + 痴 (molester) = 音痴 (terrible at --xxx)
    Star-16Star-16
愚痴 をこばす ( ぐち をこばす)
    grumble or mutter a complaint over and over - to bitch, whine, grouse, sing the blues. (as opposed to 文句 (もんく) which means make a loud and articulate complaint) (1 or 2 KANA)
    愚 (dum diddy dum dum) + 痴 (molester) = 愚痴 (grumble)
    Star-16Star-16

Number: 1360
愉 pleasure
Star-16
12 strokes
SIDEKICK, DUPE
心 (heart) + Butcher (butcher) (Same-ON)

ONYOMI: YU

Wearing Your Underpants gives me a pleasure I simply cant describe.

He became a butcher is because chopping meat gives his heart pleasure.

DESCRIPTION: This tanoshii means the same as the OTHER tanoshii (楽しい), except that 愉しい is very literary and pretentious.

Basically the only time youll see 愉しい is if your friend is typing on his cell phone and the "auto-complete" feature selects this one instead of the usual one. However, that happens a lot in todays troubled society, so it might be worth your while to learn 愉しい. (As a matter of fact, theres a LOT of kanji that only occur as a result of auto-complete snafus. Older folks who complain that the internets is making young Japanese kind of illiterate and culturally myopic should be thanking auto-complete - its responsible for accidentally reviving a whole CLASS of old words! )

KUNYOMI:

たの＊しい
    enjoyable! Fun!
    Star-16

JUKUGO:

愉快 な ( ゆかい な)
    pleasant or amusing (a funny guy, hilarious comments, a fun time)
    愉 (pleasure) + 快 (pleasant) = 愉快 (amusing)
    - zero stars! -

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
愉 	pleasure 	BUTCHER 	Butcher
惚 	to fall in love with 	RIBCAGE 	Thing

It gives the BUTCHER pleasure to fall in love with a ANIMAL RIBCAGE.

Number: 1364
癖 bad habit

Sickness (sick) + Stinky (stinky)

Thats a HECK of a bad habit!

KUNYOMI:

くせ ( になる )
    bad habit. But not that bad. Gambling or hoe-hopping is like a "akushumi". 癖 is just like biting your nails or saying "like" a lot, although it is usually more unique and distinctive.
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

ｘｘｘの 癖 に YYY!! (ｘｘｘの くせ に YYY!!)
    a very disapproving way of saying "but still". As in, "He dont even have money for rent but still he just got a ＄２00 Bathing Ape shoe.": 家賃の金もないの癖に二万円bape靴を買っちゃった！ (1 or 2 KANA)

Number: 1371
申 humbly say or god radical
Star-16Star-16Star-16
5 strokes
PK, SYMBOLIC, STRONG, JERK RADICAL
(right radical)
田 (rice field) + 一 (one or line radical)

ONYOMI:

The line goes above and below the rice field, because rice fields represent Earth, but God goes from Heaven (above) to Hell (below).

Simple.

DESCRIPTION: The kunyomi is only used on formal occasions, but you should learn it anyway because it is like one of the most common formal words!

On the other hand, as a radical, it means "god",and it is seen really often.

STRONG RADICAL for the ON-yomi of SHIN.

KUNYOMI:

( と ) もう＊す
    When youre talking to a superior person, you use 申す instead of 言う to describe your own speech. (Instead of saying, My name is Ruttiger, youd say Ruttigerともうします！’） (F)
    Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

申し訳ない ( もうしわけない )
    really really really sorry. That your mom got big-boned. (F)
    申 (humbly say) + 訳 (reason or translation) = 申し訳ない (sorryn shit)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
申し込む ( もうしこむ )
    an application (for a loan or to go to college, etc)
    申 (humbly say) + 込 (get crowded) = 申し込む (application)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
甲 	turtle shell 	line goes DOWN 	
由 	freedom or reason 	line goes UP 	
申 	humbly say 	LINE GOES UP AND DOWN 	

The turtles head(甲) goes DOWN into its shell.

But you have the freedom to reach UP(由) to the stars.

GOD　(申)is infinite so the line sticks OUT ON BOTH SIDEZZZ.
USED IN:

    痩
    紳
    捜
    伸
    神

Number: 1399
霊 ghost
Star-16
15 strokes
BETA
雨 (rain) + 二 (two) + Hedgehog (hedgehog)

ONYOMI: REI

I shot him with my RAYgun and he turned into a ghost.

Here come the ghosts of 2 deceased hedgehogs who died in the rainstorm.
JUKUGO:

幽霊 ( ゆうれい )
    a vengeful ghost - unlike 悪霊（あくりょう） and 妖怪 （ようかい）, 幽霊 were once human and driven by revenge. 幽霊 are more popular in horror movies (like The Ring), whereas 妖怪 are more traditional.
    幽 (occult) + 霊 (ghost) = 幽霊 (ghost)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
悪霊 ( あくりょう )
    an evil spirit; a spirit who puts curses on people, or brings misfortune to entire towns, or possesses innocent fools. Unlike 幽霊, they dont attack you directly, and unlike 妖怪 dont have a physical form (FP)
    悪 (bad) + 霊 (ghost) = 悪霊 (evil spirit)
    Star-16
霊感 ( れいかん )
    inspiration.

    To get inspired: 霊感を受ける（うける）

    To inspire someone: 霊感を与える（あたえる）
    霊 (ghost) + 感 (feeling) = 霊感 (inspiration)
    Star-16

    撲 (eradicate) + 滅 (annihilate) = 撲滅 (eradicate)

相撲 ( すもう )
    Sumo. Ive seen a bunch of of straight porn featuring sexy sumo wrestler girls, but Ive been unable to find a single gay sumo porn. Which either means, a) gay dudes think sumo are trolls, b) gay dudes have too much respect for the manliness of Sumo to do a x-rated parody, or c) gay dudes just jerk it to regular sumo on the tube for free. (FP, CCW)
    相 (partner) + 撲 (eradicate) = 相撲 (Sumo)
    - zero stars! -

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
僕 	me (for dudes) 	PERSON 	人
撲 	eradicate 	HAND 	手

Me is a PERSON, who is eradicating you with my HAND.
QED motherfucker.


Number: 1404
Dragon dragon radical
田 (rice field) + 一 (one or line radical)

DESCRIPTION: Lets call the curved line on the bottom, a "tail."
So now we can say,. . .
Theres a dragon trying to hide in the rice field , but you can tell because its tail is sticking out.

USED IN:

    竜
    滝
    電
    俺
    亀



Number: 1405
竜 dragon
Star-16Star-16
10 strokes
PN, COCK
立 (stand up) + Dragon (dragon radical)

ONYOMI: RYUU

Bruce Lee has a new environmentally friendly movie out called REUSE THE DRAGON.

When the dragon stands up you are pretty much a lost cause.

KUNYOMI:

たつ
    In theory, the kunyomi of dragon is TATSU - but oddly its never used ABOUT DRAGONS THEMSELVES. For example, if you see a dragon, you have to use the ON yomi - Hey! Its a ryuu! However - CONFUSINGLY - some jukugo - such as seahorse and tornado use this kunyomi (TATSU). . . .Its basically the reverse of how kun and on are usually used. (COCK)
    - zero stars! -

JUKUGO:

恐竜 ( きょうりゅう )
    dinosaur!!
    恐 (dread) + 竜 (dragon) = 恐竜 (dinosaur!! )
    Star-16
竜巻 ( たつまき )
    whirlwind or tornado
    竜 (dragon) + 巻 (roll up) = 竜巻 (whirlwind)
    - zero stars! -

Number: 1411
Comb comb
PK
(bottom radical)

DESCRIPTION: For some reason, kanji using the comb radical tend to have a lot of elaborate nuances. Read on for the boring details!
USED IN:

    需
    耐
    端



Number: 1412
需 demand
Star-16Star-16
14 strokes
BETA
雨 (rain) + Comb (comb)

ONYOMI: JU

I demand your Juicy Underwear!

My hair got wet in the rain and I demand to receive a comb.
JUKUGO:

需要 ( じゅよう )
    a demand, a need - doesnt need to be made by a person. (i.e. "This situation demands action!" or "Supply of shiny plastic things cannot keep up with the markets demand!"

    This does NOT get to turn into a verb. You dont use する. Youd say 需要がある (theres a demand for xxx) or perhaps　　需要を　満たす　（じゅようをもたす） (theres enough of xxx to meet the demand). (NP)
    需 (demand) + 要 (important) = 需要 (demand)
    Star-16Star-16
必需品 ( ひつじゅひん )
    necessities: both on everyday occasions and on adventures. Like if youre leaving the house you need your keitai and your keys! But also if youre going to the moon you need your ray gun and your moon bikini.
    必 (surely) + 需 (demand) + 品 (products) = 必需品 (necessities)
    - zero stars! -



Number: 1413
耐 withstand
Star-16Star-16
19 strokes
DUPE
Comb (comb) + 寸 (glueglue)

ONYOMI: TAI

The masochist can withstand being TIED up.

The comb can withstand glue without becoming stuck in your hair!

KUNYOMI:

( に ) たえ＊る
    withstand something physical - Fire resistant, or water-resistant. People, too: if you try to be a coal-miner and you cant take the physical labor then you 耐えらない。 (1 or 2 KANA)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

忍耐 ( にんたい )
    patience, forbearance -basically it is a more formal version of 我慢　（がまん）. However, 我慢 can be used in the active sense of "keep doing what youre doing, keep rolling that rock up the hill, dont quit." Whereas, 忍耐 has more a passive nuance - "Continue doing nothing, fight the urge to counter-attack or snap back." (NP)
    忍 (hide or endure) + 耐 (withstand) = 忍耐 (forbear, endure)
    - zero stars! -
耐久性 ( たいきゅうせい )
    durability (NP)
    耐 (withstand) + 久 (been a long time) + 性 (sex or essential nature) = 耐久性 (durability)
    - zero stars! -



Number: 1414
端 the edge
Star-16Star-16Star-16
14 strokes
PN
立 (stand up) + 山 (mountain) + Comb (comb)

ONYOMI: TAN

His TAN is so deep he is on the edge of getting a melanoma.

Stand on the edge of the mountain and comb your hair (FYI you are super nonchalant)

KUNYOMI:

はし
    edge (always literal, never figurative) (of your seat, edge of the plank) As opposed to 縁（fuchi) 、　端 usually refers to ONE POINT on the edge, the most extreme point (i.e. edge of the cliff, tip of the peninsula)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

中途半端 な ( ちゅうとはんぱ な)
    this is an excellent phrase. It means, to do things halfway. Whether its doing a half-ass job at your work, or taking a girl out on a date . . . .to burger king, or cleaning your room but only to the extent that your moms turds are in a bag and not on the floor. - thats all CHUUTOHANPA.
    中 (middle) + 途 (on the way) + 半 (half) + 端 (the edge) = 中途半端 (half-assed job)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
極端 な ( きょくたん な)
    extreme - Ｕsed about people, people who take things too far. (not tempratures or political ideologies) A 2-foot-tall mohawk is 極端.
    極 (extreme) + 端 (the edge) = 極端 (extreme)
    Star-16Star-16
xxxたと 端 にYYY (xxxたと にYYY)
    No sooner had I done XXX, when YYY happened. (where the た is the end of a past-tense verb: tabeta, nonda, hashitta, etc.)
    Star-16

strong RADICAL for HOU!

Number: 1421
抱 hug
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
8 strokes
SOLO
Hand (handleft) + Wrap (wrap) (Same-ON)

ONYOMI: HOU,COCK

Hes a christian, so hell just hug HOES instead of fornicating them.

You hug by wrapping your hands around someone.

DESCRIPTION: Youd think that hug would be the nicest kanji, but no, its another COCK.

Both kunyomi have the same particle (を) AND the same okurigana (く), but are pronounced differently . . . so its impossible to tell which one it is!

Luckily, one of the kunyomi is very very rarely used, so you can just assume its the other one. Sigh.

KUNYOMI:

だ＊く
    hug
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
いだ＊く
    metaphorically hold (a suspicion, a belief, a grudge) (1 or 2 KANA)
    - zero stars! -

抱 	hug 	MYSELF 	己

I hug by wrapping MYSELF around someone.


Number: 1422
句 verse of a poem
Star-16Star-16Star-16
5 strokes
BETA
Wrap (wrap) + 口 (mouth or small box radical) (Same-ON)

ONYOMI: KU

This is a sensitive love poem is about a COOCHIE.

When you mouth a verse, you wrap your words in poetry.

DESCRIPTION: Dont confuse 句(verse) with 可!

可 is straight lines, because its the nail radical - nails are straight!

But, 句 uses the wrapping radical, (not hard iron, but soft paper or cloth), so its round and organic.
JUKUGO:

文句 ( もんく )
    complain (FP)
    文 (culture or  sentence) + 句 (verse of a poem) = 文句 (complain)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
禁句 ( きんく )
    forbidden, tabboo word
    禁 (prohibition) + 句 (verse of a poem) = 禁句 (forbidden, tabboo word)
    Star-16Star-16
俳句 ( はいく )
    yo mama so fat or she went to the zoo one time or kids fed her peanuts
    俳 (actor) + 句 (verse of a poem) = 俳句 (haiku)
    Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical

JUKUGO:

尊敬語 ( そんけいご )
    the formal Japanese you use when you are addressing your superiors. (F)
    尊­敬 (to look up to or respect someone. (BOOBOO: its not ok to tell someone directly, I 尊敬 you very much! - youd say it about a third party)) + 語 (language) = 尊敬語 (formal Japanese)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
尊敬 する ( そんけい する)
    to look up to or respect someone. (BOOBOO: its not ok to tell someone directly, I 尊敬 you very much! - youd say it about a third party)
    尊 (esteem) + 敬 (respect) = 尊敬 (respect)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

Number: 1424
警 the fuzz

19 strokes
BETA

JUKUGO:

警察 ( けいさつ )
    police (NP)
    警 (the fuzz) + 察 (police) = 警察 (police)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
警察署 ( けいさつしょ )
    police station
    警­察 (police) + 署 (government office) = 警察署 (police station)
    Star-16Star-16
警告 ( けいこく )
    a warning or admonition. Not like "Be careful!" but more like "You better not!"

    Usually applies to signs like "no tresspassing!"
    警 (the fuzz) + 告 (inform) = 警告 (admonition)
    Star-16Star-16
警視庁 ( けいしちょう )
    regular uniformed city cops (as opposed to local cops or specialized cops like 警察庁　(けいさつちょう, meaning detectives), FBI, etc.)
    警 (the fuzz) + 視 (peer at) + 庁 (metropolitan government) = 警視庁 (metro police)
    Star-16

The police SAY things to astonish a HORSE.

And then the horse is like, "Deeeeeeeeeeeyammnn!!"

水 (waterleft) + 日 (sun, day) + 匂 (scent (good or bad))

ONYOMI: KATSU

The CATS got thirsty in the sun and went sniffing for the scent of water. (Good luck with that.)

KUNYOMI:

( が ) かわ*く
    something which is or should be wet , becomes dry: My eyes are dry. My throat is dry. Usually only used when you are thirsty, as in: のどが渇いてる!のど が かわいてる! Im thirsty!
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
湯 	hot water 	THING 	Thing
渇 	thirsty 	HEEL 	Heel

Hot water is a THING you want to soak in if your HEELS are parched.

Number: 1433
約 promise or  roughly speaking
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
9 strokes
JERK
糸 (string) + Promise (promise)

ONYOMI: YAKU

I promise to keep the YAK on the string, and not let it run away like last time.

DESCRIPTION: JERK； When used in a jukugo, it means "promise", but when used as a SUFFIX、it means "roughly speaking" . . . . although suffixes are always part of a jukugo, arent they? So it is hard to tell the difference.

KUNYOMI:

( XXX ) 約
    roughly speaking. Ish. 9yards約。 3 days約。 (SUF)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

約束 ( やくそく )
    promise
    約 (promise or  roughly speaking) + 束 (bundle of sticks) = 約束 (promise)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
予約 ( よやく )
    reservation, appointment
    予 (beforehand) + 約 (promise or  roughly speaking) = 予約 (reservation)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

    marriage engagement
    婚 (marriage) + 約 (promise or  roughly speaking) = 婚約 (marriage engagement)
    Star-16Star-16
条約 ( じょうやく )
    a treaty or pact
    条 (clause) + 約 (promise or  roughly speaking) = 条約 (a treaty or pact)
    - zero stars! -

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
約 	promise or  roughly speaking 	STRING 	糸

The motivation of the Revolution is to get WHITEY.


Number: 1434
的 motivation or -al
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
8 strokes
JERK, SUF
白 (white) + Promise (promise)

ONYOMI: TEKI

My motivation is to fuck up my TEKI (teki =敵= enemy).

I promise that my motivation is only to catch white fish, not fish of color.

KUNYOMI:

まと
    objective, target
    Star-16

JUKUGO:

XXX 的 (XXX てき )
    Mostly this is used as a SUFFIX which turns a noun into an adjective. Like how politics becomes political, or how education becomes educational. or economics becomes economical. In Japanese, 政治　becomes　政治的な. (SUF)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
目的 ( もくてき )
    motive, not only for crimes.
    目 (eye) + 的 (motivation or -al) = 目的 (motive, not only for crimes.)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
自動的 な ( じどうてき な)
    automatic
    自 (my own) + 動 (movement) + 的 (motivation or -al) = 自動的 (automatic)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
理想的 な ( りそうてき な)
    ideal.
    理 (reason) + 想 (idea or imagination) + 的 (motivation or -al) = 理想的 (ideal.)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
基本的 な ( きほんてき な)
    the basics (the emphasis is: the minimum knowledge)

    Also means fundamentally (emphasizing the essential bits that various things or ideas have in common)
    基 (basis) + 本 (book or the real) + 的 (motivation or -al) = 基本的 (the basics)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
合理的 な ( ごうりてき な)
    rational OR reasonable (i.e. get up at a reasonable hour or a reasonable compromise - like logical, but used even if there is not a mathematical proof involved. Also has the nuance of efficient - the boss says to the worker 仕事合理的に進めなさい！　（しごと　ごうりてき　に　すすめ　なさい！）, meaning, Stop wasting our time and money! Work in a more efficient, rational way.
    合 (to suit) + 理 (reason) + 的 (motivation or -al) = 合理的 (rational OR reasonable )
    Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
約 	promise or  roughly speaking 	STRING 	糸
的 	motivation or -al 	WHITE 	白

Tie a STRING round your finger to remember this promise:

The motivation of the Revolution is to get WHITEY.

( を ) あ＊げる

I know!) However, if youre raising anything else BUT your hand, you have to use 上げる instead of 挙げる. Yeah, I know, I know. What can you do?? (NP)
    Star-16Star-16

Number: 1455
般 general or overall
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
10 strokes
SIDEKICK
舟 (boat) + Throw (throw)

ONYOMI: HAN

HAN Solo is, in general, kind of a wise-ass.

In general, boats are thrown into the harbor, more often than thrown on land.
JUKUGO:

一般的 な ( いっぱんてき な)
    One of many many Japanese words for normal. The nuance of いっぱんてき　is ordinary, non-special - as opposed to a member of a special group of people of things. 一般的な人 means, an average person. As in, an average person is not allowed in this Yakuza bar.
    一­般 (generally, commonly) + 的 (motivation or -al) = 一般的 (ordinary)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
一般 に ( いっぱん に)
    generally, commonly
    一 (one) + 般 (general or overall) = 一般 (generally, commonly)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
船 	ship 	EIGHT 	八
航 	navigation 	BERET 	Lid
般 	general or overall 	THROW 	Throw

The left-hand radical is the MUTANT RADICAL for cat- it looks like a cats paw with claws extended.

So you can say:

The cat is out playing with flowers in the rice field.

DESCRIPTION: SYMBOLIC for small animals in general

KUNYOMI:

ねこ
    cat (1 or 2 KANA)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

招き猫 ( まねきねこ )
    the little cat in all the shop windows. Its kind of a weird phenomenon if you think about it: One paw is up, beckoning customers to come in, like "Come on in, guy! I like your style!" But the other paw clutches a gold coin, usually marked 10,000,000 yen. Like "OK, J or K about valuing you. I just want your money." (CCW)
    招 (beckon) + 猫 (cat) = 招き猫 (shop-window cat)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
子猫 ( こねこ )
    kitten (KUNKUN)
    子 (child) + 猫 (cat) = 子猫 (kitten)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
野良猫 ( のらねこ )
    stray cat (FP, KANA)
    野 (field) + 良 (good) + 猫 (cat) = 野良猫 (stray cat)
    Star-16
猫舌 ( ねこじた )
    someone who dont like spicy food. (KUNKUN)
    猫 (cat) + 舌 (tongue) = 猫舌 (someone who dont like spicy food.)
    Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
猫 	cat 	CLAW

    抑 (suppress) + 圧 (pressure) = 抑圧 (oppression)
    Star-16

    an inhibitor, or suppressor. Basically its the Noun form of 抑える.
    抑 (suppress) + 制 (system) = 抑制 (suppressor)
    - zero stars! -

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical

抑 	suppress 	HAND 	手

Number: 1489
組 ones team
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
11 strokes
CCW
糸 (string) + Abelincolnshat (Abe Lincolns Hat) (Same-ON)

ONYOMI: SO

I need Some One on my team - I cant do it alone.

Our team is all wearing Abe hats which are tied together with string. (so we cant do anything on our own - this is Japan, after all)

DESCRIPTION: Cultural Code Word; According to Alex Kerrs seminal Japan-rant DOGS AND DEMONS, kids are assigned a kumi from the first day of school, and grow up thinking in terms of insider or outsider and be-like-everyone-else. . . even MORE than regular teens. They say Asians in general are more group-oriented than selfish Westerners, but the kumi system is a specifically Japanese way of promoting group loyalty in a very rigid and some would say unthinking, ass-non-shaking way.

KUNYOMI:

くみ
    team or group.
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

組織 ( そしき )
    an organization or structure - usually social (like a union or mafia)
    組 (ones team) + 織 (organization or weave) = 組織 (organization)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

    tv program
    番 (number) + 組 (ones team) = 番組 (tv program)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
組合 ( くみあい )
    a union or association (KUNKUN, NOKURI)
    組 (ones team) + 合 (to suit) = 組合 (a union or association)
    Star-16Star-16

阻 	hamper 	TOWN 	Town

Team spirit is the STRING that binds us into a unit.

We do NECROPHILIA with our ancestors.

The TREE is our partner in the oxygen or co2 cycle.

My RICE is bad quality so everyone in TOWN hampered me from selling it!

査 inspect

BETA

調査 する ( ちょうさ する)
    an investigation. Emphasizes that there are no correct answers, and implies that the investigators are talking to someone, asking questions directly. (usually used about polls, surveys, and detectives questioning suspects and or or witnesses)
    調 (check out) + 査 (inspect) = 調査 (investigate)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
検査 する ( けんさ する)
    Medical checkup. Also, investigation, inspection, review: (fiancial audit, smog check, check the condition of goods that roll off the assemby line, etc). Has the nuance of a test where something passes or fails.
    検 (investigate) + 査 (inspect) = 検査 (checkup)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16

    rude, without manners.

    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
お礼 に ( おれい に)
    in thanks for. As in, "In thanks for the sweater, I bought him a moray eel."
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
礼儀 ( れいぎ )
    politeness.
    礼 (polite) + 儀 (politeness) = 礼儀 (politeness.)
    Star-16Star-16
礼金 ( れいきん )
    literally politeness money. - sometimes the phrase "key money" is also used - as if that explains anything. This is the legalized bribe you pay for the privilege of paying rent on a new apartment.
    礼 (polite) + 金 (gold) = 礼金 (key money)
    Star-16Star-16

NECROPHILIACS are very polite because they never get a lady pregnant or give her an STD.

    complicated; having multiple things that make it complex.
    複 (complicated or compound) + 雑 (miscellaneous , random) = 複雑 (complicated)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
複数形 ( ふくすうけい )
    Plural - in English ! . . .The Japanese language doesnt really have a word for plural, but Japanese use 複数形 to describe English plurals. So youll need this word to correct your Japanese friends frequent grammar boners.
    "Look at the deers!"
    "Deer doesnt have 複数形、, Yoshio。 3 deer is still deer."
    "チクショウ！”
    複­数 (multiple (causes of the disease or reasons for the decision or effects of the medicine)) + 形 (form) = 複数形 (plural)
    Star-16Star-16
複数 ( ふくすう )
    multiple (causes of the disease or reasons for the decision or effects of the medicine)
    複 (complicated or compound) + 数 (number, to count) = 複数 (multiple)
    - zero stars! -

in the ORGAN of her entrails.

    2 meanings: 1) I send something flying. 2) to skip a page, to skip a step in a process, to skip a turn in a game.
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
( が ) と＊ぶ
    it flies
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

飛行機 ( ひこうき )
    airplane
    飛 (fly) + 行 (go) + 機 (machine) = 飛行機 (airplane)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
が　or へ 飛び出す (が　or へ とびだす )
    to jump out in front of you suddenly. Normally youll see this on road signs, "Drive slow! Children might dash out!" Unlike the related words 跳躍 and 踊る, 飛び出す emphasizes jumping FROM a place. Jumping FROM the side of the road, or FROM the shadows. (1 or 2 KANA)
    飛 (fly) + 出 (pull out or hand over) = 飛び出す (jump up from out of nowhere)
    Star-16Star-16
飛躍 ( ひやく )
    a leap. Usually figurative. Make a leap forward in technology. Not used as a verb.
    飛 (fly) + 躍 (jump) = 飛躍 (a leap)
    Star-16

共産主義 ( きょうさんしゅぎ )
    communism
    共 (with) + 産 (childbirth, production of things) + 主­義 (SUFFIX meaning ism. As in capitalism, communism, materialism, and a Japanese grindcore band called intestine baalism. ) = 共産主義 (communism)
    Star-16Star-16
共有 ( きょうゆう )
    shared or communal or jointly owned things.
    共 (with) + 有 (exist) = 共有 (jointly owned)
    Star-16Star-16

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
共 	with 	LINES POINTING DOWN 	
並 	line up or ordinary 	LINES POINTING UP 	

共 has lines pointing down, because it means youre DOWN with someone.

並 has lines pointing up because it means LINE UP.
USED IN:

    巷
    供
    選
    洪
    異
    暴

補 supplement

KUNYOMI:

おぎな*う
    to suppliment - like 補充, but the nuance is that you are filling a vacancy. For instance, nutritional suppliment. Substitute teacher. Assist in the completion of something (I helped write the speech). To make up for (i.e. Mitsubishi bank loaned money to Toyota to make up for their shortfall) みつびし銀行はトヨタの赤字補いました。
    Star-16

    candidate

    Star-16Star-16
補充 する ( ほじゅう する)
    to suppliment, (a shortfall or deficit) or replenish (fluids, vitamins to replenish strength, restock the store-room) - its like 補う, but the nuance is that you are restocking a supply of something which has dwindled.
    補 (supplement) + 充 (fill up) = 補充 (suppliment)
    - zero stars! -

	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
捕 	capture 	HAND 	手
補 	supplement 	DUCKY 	Clothing

You use your HAND to capture,

but you use A DUCKY to supplement your bubble-bath.

    Star-16Star-16Star-16
結構 です。 ( けっこう です。)
    this has 3 meanings, each used just as often as the others .

    1)literally, "OK."

    2) "No thank you" (just like American women, Japanese people use Thats ok to mean No.!)

    3) "Very much" : You often hear people saying, "Kekkou atsui ne!" ("Its very hot today, eh?") (1 or 2 KANA, JERK)
    結 (bind) + 構 (set up or care about) = 結構 (ok or no thanks or very)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
お構いなく ( おかまいなく! )
    a polite way to say, "Dont worry about it."
    Star-16Star-16

    構 (set up or care about) + 造 (produce) = 構造 ( structure)

    五 (five) + 日 (sun, day) = 五日 (fifth day of month)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

USED IN:

    語
    悟
    互
    Orgy

    to tell a story

    English
    英 (heroic) + 語 (language) = 英語 (English)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
フランス語 ( ふらんすご )
    French
    ラ () + ラ () + 語 (language) = フランス語 (French)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
ｘｘｘ 語 (ｘｘｘ go )
    SUFFIX meaning "language of xxx-country" (for example, フランス語、ドイツ語） (SUF)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
主語 ( しゅご )
    the subject of the sentence. AKA the thing Japanese people never say.
    主 (master or mainly) + 語 (language) = 主語 (subject)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
物語 ( ものがたり )
    a tale- often used in the title of a book or movie. As in the tale of genji tale of two cities. (KUNKUN, NOKURI)
    物 (animal or thing) + 語 (language) = 物語 (tale)
    Star-16Star-16
同意語 ( どういご )
    synonym
    同 (same) + 意 (meaning) + 語 (language) = 同意語 (synonym)
    Star-16
同音異義語 ( どうおんいぎご )
    homonym
    同 (same) + 音 (sound) + 異 (to differ) + 義 (righteousness) + 語 (language) = 同音異義語 (homonym)
    Star-16

Number: 1582
違 different and therefore wrong
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
13 strokes
CCW
Moving (motion) + Orgy (orgy) (Same-ON)

ONYOMI: I

I am different and wrong, and so is this dictionary.

Moving towards an orgy is different and wrong.

KUNYOMI:

( が ) ちが＊う
    nuh-uh! Wrong! Its not like that at all!
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

間違い ( まちがい )
    a mistake (1 or 2 KANA)
    間 (a period of time) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 間違い (a mistake)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
勘違い する ( かんちがい する)
    a misunderstanding - like the related term 誤解 , but 勘違い is a little smaller. If Im reading and confuse one kanji with a similar looking kanji, thats 勘違い. But if I see my fiancee with her cousin from out of town, and assume shes having an affair and punch the guy, thats 誤解
    勘 (perception) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 勘違い (misunderstanding)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
気違い ( きちがい )
    (literally, different feeling) crazy - this is one of the biggest cusses in the whole language-a garunteed fight-starter. This is instructive in several ways.

    1) Japanese is such a polite language that different feeling is one of the worst insults.

    2) it takes a certain kind of culture to think that having a different feeling is such a bad thing in the first place!

    3) Historically it is a discriminatory term against people who suffer from mental illness. (ABU)
    気 (mood) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 気違い (fuckin crazy)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
相違 ( そうい )
    a somewhat formal word for difference (NP)
    相 (partner) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 相違 (a somewhat formal word for difference)
    Star-16

Number: 1590
料 ingredients or fees
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
10 strokes
BETA, JERK

REORDER more ingredients.

Get the ingredients and the rice from the spice rack. This is gonna be some nut-busting risotto here, I tell you that right now.
JUKUGO:

料理 つくる ( りょうり つくる)
    ２ meanings.
    1： cooking , as in, "My hobby is cooking. Im cooking right now, I cant talk."
    2： cuisine, as in, "My favorite cuisine is Mexican. My favorite cuisine is Indonesian."
    (BOOBOO: You dont say, though, "Im going to buy some ryouri." Or "Im eating ryouri right now." )
    料 (ingredients or fees) + 理 (reason) = 料理 (cuisine or cooking)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
無料 ( むりょう )
    free (not like Martin Luther King, I mean free like a free magazine full of articles on how to become a stripper)
    無 (without) + 料 (ingredients or fees) = 無料 (free)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
料金 ( りょうきん )
    a fee, also, bills.
    料 (ingredients or fees) + 金 (gold) = 料金 (a fee, also, bills.)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
給料 ( きゅうりょう )
    wages - a bit more useful than the related word 給与. For instance, payday is 給料日 (きゅうりょうび)、 not 給与日.
    給 (provide) + 料 (ingredients or fees) = 給料 (wages)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
香辛料 ( こうしんりょう )
    spices - not just hot ones. This is the only word youll ever need the onyomi for. Sorry.
    香 (good smell) + 辛 (spicy or painful) + 料 (ingredients or fees) = 香辛料 (spices)
    Star-16

then use RICE ingredients for something to eat.

KUNYOMI:

( に ) あやま*る
    apologize　(BOOBOO: This is only used when describing actions after the fact. You wouldnt step on someones toes and then say わたしはあやまります！)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16

JUKUGO:

に 感謝 する (に かんしゃ する)
    The most common, general word for gratitude.
    感 (feeling) + 謝 (apologize) = 感謝 (gratitude)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
謝罪 する ( しゃざい する)
    apologize (NP)
    謝 (apologize) + 罪 (sin) = 謝罪 (apologize)
    - zero stars! -



Number: 1603
窮 to be in trouble
Star-16
15 strokes
DUPE, BETA
穴 (hole) + 弓 (bow) + 身 ((ones own) flesh)

ONYOMI: KYUU

CUTE guys are nothing but trouble.

When a bow shoots a hole in your flesh, you bet your ass youre in trouble.

KUNYOMI:

( が ) きわ＊まる
    To be caught in a dillema, to have your back to the wall, to the point where there seems to be no hope. Almost never used.
    - zero stars! -

JUKUGO:

窮屈 な ( きゅうくつ な)
    ：stiff or formal, tight-assed.
    窮 (to be in trouble) + 屈 (yield, get out of the way) = 窮屈 (tight-assed. )
    Star-16
窮地 に ( きゅうち に)
    to be up a creek, in a predicament, painted into a corner, fucked.
    窮 (to be in trouble) + 地 (area) = 窮地 (FUCKED)
    Star-16



Number: 1604
Scorpion scorpion
STRONG, PK
(bottom radical)

DESCRIPTION: Often - but not always - STRONG RADICAL for CHI.
USED IN:

    地
    池
    他
    施



Number: 1605
地 area
Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
6 strokes
BETA
土 (earth) + Scorpion (scorpion) (Same-ON)

ONYOMI: CHI, JI

Damn it smells good in here. Did JESUS cut the CHEESE in this area?

Dangerous scorpions are on the earth in that area.

DESCRIPTION:This is different from other place kanji like 場 and 所, because 地 doesnt emphasize the a particular activity done at the place : 地 instead emphasizes the land, the physical, geographical aspects of the space.
JUKUGO:

地図 ( ちず )
    map
    地 (area) + 図 (diagram or  map) = 地図 (map)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
地域 ( ちいき )
    a region or district, a zone. (emphasizes a social community moreso than a geographical area) (i.e. you wouldnt use it for the tropics or the Arctic, but youd use it for Chinatown ,the American South or Kanto or Kansai)
    地 (area) + 域 (region) = 地域 (district, zone)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
地球 ( ちきゅう )
    the world, the physical planet Earth.
    地 (area) + 球 (sphere) = 地球 (earth)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
地震 ( じしん )
    earthquake (FP)
    地 (area) + 震 (shake, tremble) = 地震 (earthquake)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16
地面 ( じめん )
    the ground or floor (applies both inside and outside)
    地 (area) + 面 (front surface or face) = 地面 (ground)
    Star-16Star-16
地帯 ( ちたい )
    a geographical district or zone - emphaizes a physical location: the tropics, the steppes. ちたい is much bigger and broader than 地域.
    地 (area) + 帯 (belt) = 地帯 (zone)
    Star-16Star-16
地理 ( ちり )
    geography
    地 (area) + 理 (reason) = 地理 (geography)
    Star-16

Number: 1607
他 other

5 strokes
Man (personleft) + Scorpion (scorpion)

    other　－ another thing of the same type.

JUKUGO:

その他 ( そのほか )
    the others, as well as, furthermore, etc. (often seen on charts: 45% Republican, 45% Democrat, その他 10%)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16Star-16
他人 ( たにん )
    other people, people around you (emphasis is slightly negative: theyre not in your group, so who cares about them?)
    他 (other) + 人 (person) = 他人 (other people)
    Star-16Star-16Star-16



Number: 1608

    to give to charity (1 or 2 KANA)

JUKUGO:

施設 ( しせつ )
    an institution, some facilities. (a mental hospital or sports stadium or orphanage or water filtration plant)
    施 (put into practice or charity) + 設 (establish) = 施設 (institution or facilities)
    Star-16Star-16
実施 する ( じっし する)
    to put something - a plan or rule - into effect
    実 (truth) + 施 (put into practice or charity) = 実施 (in full effect)
    - zero stars! -

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
贈 	give 	MONEY 	貝
増 	increase 	EARTH 	土
憎 	detest 	HEART 	心
慣 	adapt 	not HORNY 	
僧 	buddhist monk 	PERSON 	人

You give MONEY away.

The EARTHS temperature increases.

You detest me with all your HEART.

I adapt to it because Im NOT HORNY for you anyway.

A monk is a PERSON.

Number: 1614
層 layer
Star-16Star-16
14 strokes
BETA
Corpse (corpse) + 曽 (get)

ONYOMI: SOU

When ice cube starts killing crackers, the pile of corpses gets layers SO fast it is like, damn, he really doesnt like crackers.
JUKUGO:

一層 ( いっそう )
    all the more. As in, He ignores me and it just makes me love him all the more.
    一 (one) + 層 (layer) = 一層 (all the more)
    Star-16
ｘｘｘ 層 (ｘｘｘ そう )
    SUFFIX meaning, layer of xxx. As in, オゾン層 (おぞんそう = ozone layer) (SUF)
    Star-16
階層 ( かいそう )
    stratum of society - broke, blue-collar, middle-class, rich, oligarch
    階 (story of a building) + 層 (layer) = 階層 (stratum of society)
    - zero stars! -

LOOKALIKES:
	Meaning 	Hint 	Radical
属 	genus or affiliation 	BUGS 	虫
層 	layer 	GET 	曽

BUGS have genus and species. Layers GET piled up.

Number: 1616
Beuracracy bureaucracy
PK

DESCRIPTION: . . . because it is used in the kanji for bureaucrat, but mostly because it looks like a capital "B."

HOW TO TELL THEM APART: Unlike 呂, has a straight spine running down the left side- because bureaucrats are inflexible. Also because the letter "B" has a straight line on the left.
USED IN:

    官
    追
    師
